oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Civil War drum from a Union regiment
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Circular wooden drum frame without the skin heads, with brass studs and red white and blue color rendering of the American eagle and the words "[--] Regt. Infantry" painted on the side. The number of the regiment is indecipherable. Found in Wears Valley by an 11-year old boy, West Crowson, soon after the war.
